creator: eu@uland.com
text:
"unless" property for <task> doesn't accept boolean true/false value. For 
example if I set property using <uptodate> task I can't use that property 
for "unless".

Which <task> are you talking about?

The only element in Ant 1.4.1 that supports if and unless is <target> and this
one only checks whether a given property exists or not (without looking at the
value).  This is by design.
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text:
I've been kindly reminded by Diane (thanks) that there are a few other elements
that support if/unless, <include> and <exclude> for example, sorry.

Anyway, all of them behave the same way, i.e. they don't look at the value of
a property, only check their existance.
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text:
Sorry, it's my typo. 

"unless" property for <target> doesn't accept boolean true/false value. For 
example if I set property using <uptodate> task I can't use that property 
for "unless".

I suggest to change the "if"/"unless" behavior and check value of the property 
as well, to be able to use it together with <uptodate> task.

Another possible solution is to change behavior of <uptodate> to match with the 
<target> behavior.

The build file I have problem with is looks like this:

...
<target name="t1">
  ...
  <uptodate property="t2.notRequired">
    ...
  </uptodate>
</target>

<target name="t2" depends="t1" unless="t2.notRequired">
  ..
</target>
...
creator: eu@uland.com

text:
<uptodate> won't set the property at all if all files are up to date, so it is
consistent with <target>'s behavior.

I think there must be either some other task that sets t2.notRequired or
<uptodate> thinks something is outdated.  Running with -verbose or even -debug
should give you a hint.
creator: bodewig@apache.org
